body.p: The bones of your body are mineralized structures that make up a major portion of your skeleton. In the broad sense, a bone is composed of bone tissue, cartilage, ligaments, tendons, vasculature, and nervous tissue. Bone tissue is a collection of specialized cells (osteoblasts, osteoclasts, osteocytes), organic extracellular matrix proteins (collagen and proteoglycans) and inorganic salt crystals that work together to provide strength and flexibility.
